								Jet Racing Extreme is a racing game where you get behind the wheel of a jet powered car and race around one of (currently) four tracks. There's not much else to say about the game itself so I'll crack on with the rest of my review.+A fair amount of customisation is available for your car, you can change the paint colour which is pretty basic but you can also upgrade the components of your car as well as fine tune them to create the best vehicle possible+The car's damage models are good and the car breaks apart nicely upon impacts, smashing into things is a big part of the game so this is rather important+Decent sound effects, the car noises are reasonably realistic in particular-Keyboard controls are, as expected of a racing game, bad and despite the dev claiming the game is best played with a gamepad the gamepad controls are quite possibly worse with terribly thought out bindings and no way to change the bindings for the gamepad (keyboard bindings can be changed)-There are currently only four maps available, two of which are just a short section of one of the other maps-The camera occasionally swaps angle randomly and most of the camera angles in the game are completely useless for a fast paced racing game - Seemingly this has now been fixed-The driving and general physics aren't even slightly realistic despite the claims on the store page and in the forums-None of the UI is explained at all making it almost completely pointless-The point system doesn't really work properly, I sometimes got given stunt points for crashing into objects and spinning uncontrollably which doesn't really make sense-A few grammatical and spelling errors, obviously not everyone speaks perfect English but it can't be too hard to get someone to proof-read-Despite not being a mobile port (the devs are planning to port it to mobile however) it does very much feel like a game that belongs on a smartphone or tablet rather than a PC or laptop-The mouse cursor always stays visible, one of my major pet peeves in games-You can't reverse so if you crash into a wall and can't turn out of it you're forced to restart-You can't pause the game! Another of my major pet peeves, seriously it's 2015 and we can't pause our games?-As you can see from the below comment section, the dev really has no idea how to communicate with the Steam community, telling me, among other things, that I'm wrong because I disagree with himVerdict:Avoid it like the Plague (2/10)Jet Racing Extreme is a poor mobile port that fails at what it sets out to achieve, with poor controls, sub-par graphics and a fair few other issues this game is neither worth your time nor money.No drama, Just Reviews.El K.

								TLDR:Jet Racing Extreme is a simple, fast racing game with well-made damaging and destruction system. It is fun for a little bit but it is not anything special and is not worth its price. I feel like developers wanted to make a good arcade game but then mixed it with realistic damage and destruction system and it didn't match well.Details:+ Fast-paced gameplay with nice (but somehow weird) steering. The speed one can reach here is really high and it is exciting;+ Destruction and damage system - it is very good, detailed thing in this game. You can damage your wheels and even get them completely destroyed and you would still be able to drive your car. That is an interesting and well-made idea;+ Maps are nice and interesting;+/- Car upgrades - There are many upgrades available to your vehicle parts which is nice. Although, I somehow had enough money to upgrade everything to its max level after my very first race and I did not even know why. That completely ruined the upgrade system for me. Hopefully they will change it someday in the future;- Sometimes you could get a feeling that the game is actually too fast - it is very nice to feel the speed but your vehicle always crash after touching literally anything. That is frustrating and I would rather like to enjoy the speed rather than seeing my car crashing so often in such an arcade game;- I feel like developer mistakenly mixed 2 different, opposite things in this game - they created realistic game if it comes to damage, destructions and physics but I did not like that - I feel like this game should be a very fast-paced arcade racer in which you could get unbelievable, enormous speeds and enjoy the fast ride without worrying about your car getting crashed that much. Unfortunately, that is impossible - your car gets destroyed everytime it touches something and it frustrates a lot - it completely removes the "arcade" thing;- Music is repetetive and boring. So are sound effects - honestly they were making me annoyed and I could not stand them after a while;- In-game purchases - the game itself is a port from mobile game but I try not to judge it by that. However, seeing in-game purchases or "Premium" versions etc. is not good. Only if the game was incredibly cheap but it is not - that is why I am surprised they even kept these in-game purchases in a PC version. That is a big NO;- Multiplayer seems to be dead. What is even worse, single player mode is boring - you do not even compete with any other AI-controlled cars. You just drive alone;- Graphics could be better;Summing up:I cannot recommend Jet Racing Extreme at its current state. It is not worth the price with what it offers at the moment. It has very good damage and destruction system and physics are nice. However, the thing how developer mixed arcade and realistic style is a big mistake in my opinion. I hope the game will be upgraded and more features will finally be added but as for now, I cannot recommend buying this game, especially for the full price.

								I can't recommend this game in it's current state.Some general observations leading me to this conclusion:The 'Single Race' mode can't really be called a race in any sense of the word... unless you redefine the word race to mean a single car is driving on the track.Multiplayer is completely empty.'Car Tuning' is a nice idea, but the numbers are kind of useless. For example, do you know what either '15000 Spring' or '300 Damper' are supposed to mean? Me either. Neither is it intuitively clear what impact bringing these numbers up or down actually do short of trial and error.The 'Paint Lab' is also sort of neat, but only being able to pick a single color for the body makes it feel kind of limited.While I can figure out what the upgrades in the 'Parts Shop' are for, the insistence from the developers that there "is no in-app payments in Steam version of the game" is easily refuted by seeing that there is indeed a section in the parts shop which gives the user an option to buy barrels (in game currency unit) and upgrade packs for real money via PayPal.Most importantly, however, the gameplay is just not very good. While you get the sense that you're able to travel quite fast in the vehicle (and this can be quite fun for a moment), the steering and obstacles are kind of ridiculous. Any minuscule bump of an object sends the vehicle into a wild tailspin resulting in anything from the vehicle falling apart until it can no longer be driven to outright explosions. I could forgive the flaws above if the game played well, but this simply isn't the case. As funny as it can be to cause crashes and watch the vehicle fall apart after giving up on trying to 'race' properly, the novelty wears off really quickly. Even the videos promoting the game all end with some ludicrous crash sequence, tellingly enough.If the issues above (or at least the gameplay) are fixed, this has the potential to be a good game. However, given that the Early Access description describes the game as 'Technically Complete' I won't be holding my breath.Note: Game was provided to me for free via orlygift.com

								I received this game for free and was actually pretty excited to play it, but was phenomenally disappointed.As I was playing this game, I noticed that the vehicles were next to impossible to control and would fly off the track if you went at even the slightest of turns (you know those bottle rockets you would make as a kid out of old soda bottles that would jet off wildly into the air? It felt like trying to pilot one of those). I thought it might just be an isolated problem that just I was having because I didn't have any upgrades, but as I would upgrade my jet I noticed that it still was completely uncontrollable. I then looked to the Internet to see that it wasn't just my problem, it seems that just how the game was designed. Absolutely horrendous and makes the game near impossible to play.If having a driving/racing game where you CAN'T EVEN STEER THE VEHICLE wasn't a deal breaker enough:The maps are very poor, bland and look nearly identical to one another. Notice how all of the in-game screen shots are in the desert. You know why? Because seemingly all of the maps take place in the desert. Which map do you choose: racetrack in the desert 1, racetrack in the desert 2, or racetrack in the desert 3 (this time with a jump)? Boring. The developers put in basic turns and things combined with the occasional jump/bridge and such in a failed attempt to make the tracks interesting, but it doesn't matter because actually trying to use these things will make you crash.Combine all of that with a horrible soundtrack, bad controls, bizarre interface, near-nonexistent jet customization, mediocre at best graphics and the fact that the developer has seemingly abandoned this project in its Early Access phase and you get a very lackluster experience. I would not recommend that you pick this title up, even on sale. Take it at face value: not even the developer really even seems to care about it. That's saying something.

Mixing that in with inconvenient obstacles placed on the track by some narcissistic engineer to prove how awesome his speed machine is. By playing the game you can earn an in-game currency with which you can by upgrades for you vehicle. All in all, this game is definitly not for everybody. But if you like challanging racing games, are hugely into jet engine power and aerodynamica this game might be for you.Though currently, with only a single map the game can get pretty boring pretty fast, making even the $5.00 that it is now pretty steep. Personally I would also like different cars that would handle completly different, just to make playing the same track more interesting.

								2 things of note: This is an EARLY ACCESS review of the game, and as a part of a promotion, I got a free copy of the game from orlygift.comFirst of all, at this stage of development, the game is in a fairly rough state, but it does have a lot of potential, so this review is both for prospective buyers as well as some suggestions on what to focus on.The level design for the race map that is in the game so far is very large, and while there are some bugs in the design of the map (ramp edges above the ground, causing a crash when trying to use the ramp)  The map has an ample number of turns and features to make the map interesting, and there are more versions of the map and extra maps incoming according to ingame screens.The car controls currently are the biggest let down to this game, to put it simply the vehicle is hard to control with the autopilot wanting to drag you back to the center line constantly and the turning seems a bit brick like.  The car does need a reverse gear, as at one point I did get my nose of my car right against a rock and was unable to move since the rocketcar only goes forward.  The autopilot is able to be turned off, but sometimes it feels like it turns itself back on randomly at points.The default camera angle is fine most of the time, but when you start messing things up is where it goes a bit wonky, the camera seems locked to look at the roof of the car always, and while that's not a horrible thing, when making sharp turns or if you get flipped over, the experience suffers.Is the game perfect right now? No, but it looks to have quite a lot of potential and if the controls are addressed I look forward to playing this game a lot more in the future!
